he was a Rabelaisian figure in the Senate and in life , instantly recognizable by his shock of hair , his florid , oversize face , his booming Boston brogue , his powerful but pained stride .他是一个拉伯雷式的人物，无论是在参议院还是在生活中都是如此。他那浓密的白发、红润的大脸、洪亮的波士顿口音、有力但艰难的走路姿势，

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Scottish Gaelic and Irish bróg, from Old Norse brók (related to breech)
early 18th cent.: perhaps allusively from brogue, referring to the rough footwear Irish peasants

entry.tran: （尤指爱尔兰人或苏格兰人说英语时带有的）土腔，方言口音
entry.def: If someone has a brogue, they speak English with a strong accent, especially Irish or Scots.

example.ex: Gill speaks in a quiet Irish brogue.
example.tran: 吉尔说话带有轻微的爱尔兰口音。

entry.def: Brogues are thick leather shoes which have an elaborate pattern punched into the leather.
